title: Great - with room for improvement
text:
Just used the app to order 15 sleeves. Simple, intuitive to use. Good descriptions on the coffee capsule choices. Easy to make and change selections, pay and be done. One downside though, was that the app awarded me 3 free sleeves of decaf intenso capsules at the bottom of my shopping basket (great!) while at the same time giving me a pop-up warning that decaf intenso is sold out (not great). It gave me no option to choose another type of capsule for the freebie (which I assume is a benefit of having bought as many sleeves as I did).  Freebie failure.  It left me feeling, somewhat irrationally, like I lost something as a result of my purchase. This is probably not a great way for an app to leave a customer feeling.  This seems like a fixable glitch in the app, adding the ability to catch when you're sold out of your freebie item and offer alternatives. 
Overall, though, I'll definitely use the app again when I don't have time to go to a Nespresso boutique.  Oh - one more suggestion: at checkout, include the option for users to request a capsule recycling mail-in bag. Thanks.

title: Quite possibly one of the most fluid user designed apps
text: So, without going too deep into my background I‚Äôll let you know just a few things. One, I work at a five star-five diamond urban hotel and have access to fantastic traditionally made espresso on a daily basis. Two, Nespresso coffee is as good if not better than this espresso. Also, the milk frothing device that came with our Vertuo bundle is amazingly consistent at providing fantastic foamed milk. I know the amount of technique and patience it takes for an individual to master using a steam wand and IT IS NOT AN EASY technique to perform. So, that a machine can produce professional results with the touch of a button is the sign of some highly intellectual engineering; kudos on that. Lastly, for the app itself, its a joy to use. From remembering previous orders, keeping information secure, streamlining the ordering process and ease of use, and (admittedly not a result of the app, per se) the timeliness of the orders arriving is hands down some of the best customer service around. If you‚Äôre thinking about an upgrade from your single serve coffee machine, look no further. Also, beware when you travel from the comfort of your kitchen and are forced to drink lesser coffees again, as it will most likely be all the time. Nespresso is THAT good.

title: Machine connectivity is secondary & needs improvement
text:
I have both a connected Nespresso machine & the connected Barista milk frother. I also have a machine without Bluetooth connectivity. My machines appear in the order I added them, not allowing me to rearrange their placement. I don‚Äôt need to see my non-Bluetooth machine, so I‚Äôd prefer to make it last in the list. Instead I have to swipe past it to get to my connected machine. It takes multiple taps & swipes to brew my drink though the app. With the Barista machine, the recipes I DON‚ÄôT have programmed in my frother appear first. Why? I don‚Äôt want those, so instead I have to swipe past to get to the recipes I do have programmed. Finally, there‚Äôs only 1 screen that accesses the machines & it‚Äôs the first screen. So if you move to another section, it‚Äôs then multiple swipes & taps to get back to your machines. 

Seems this app is only truly good for ordering‚Äîthe rest of the info is practically useless. Clearly secondary is the machine connectivity section, which is very disappointing considering that‚Äôs the primary reason I need this app. I can order capsules online, so that should be the secondary use of the app, in my opinion. 

And since this most recent update, the app crashes upon trying to launch, so now there‚Äôs that. First world problems I guess

title: A great machine

title: A case of too much and not enough
text:
It took me two days to create my account. There was an error message every time I tried that they could not resolve. And frankly, they didn‚Äôt seem interested in resolving it. I told them that if the app wouldn‚Äôt allow me to create my account that I would return the machine. So, all their effort went into them creating my account, which I could not log into. The sale of the machine was all that seemed to matter, not any of the problems I needed resolved to actually use it. Not a great experience. In the modern world of technology support is everything and theirs sorely lacks. Also, the manual that comes with the device is a joke.

Time has passed. I can‚Äôt say I‚Äôm any more impressed. Another day and more time and I was finally able to create an account. So I ordered product. Two weeks, yes, I will receive my order in two weeks. So since I have no pods I can‚Äôt even use my new modern device. Sheesh!

Gave it time. When it works, great coffee. But, in the short time I‚Äôve had the machine, just over three months, I have had to call tech support way-too-much. They are very polite and helpful, but I have to speak with them too often. First thing in the morning I just want my coffee, not to have to call tech support first so that I can make it.

title: Good app bad coffee !!!
text:

title: Elegant meets sluggish
text: The overall app works for ordering what you need, but there are a few thing I feel can be improved. First, when entering credit card information I shouldn‚Äôt have to select a card type. Also, when having to edit information it seems it must connect to my online account to download prior to my editing as I received a 504 bad gateway error the first time trying to edit my information. Lastly, which I don‚Äôt knock the app for but think it would be nice, using information of my order quantity and frequency to determine how fast I drink through my order and send me a reminder when I get low. text:

I prefer a manual frothing wand for hot microfilmed milk, and my routine with 2 foaming jugs keeps things tidy at a distance from the sink - especially important for the office. 

The Nespresso app makes quick work of  retrieving past orders and checking on new machines and coffee blends. I‚Äôve also used it to contact support (replacement wand, water reservoir). I find Nespresso to be a class outfit with high quality, durable machines and consistent coffee. My expectations are generally high, and this has been a notably reliable espresso drink system for me.
